result.execSummary:
The defendant Dakota J. GLINES was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Manitowoc County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution to Cindy Torstenson, 3803 County Road Q, Manitowoc, WI  54220, joint and several with ALS and Jose Reyes.   Restitution is to be paid at the rate of $75.00 per month to commence upon defendant's release from jail.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Seek and maintain full-time job or work search.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Have no contact with Cindy Torstenson, her husband or her father or their residence.   

No contact with MN, Payton Spencer, Cody Spencer, Peter Dickserson, HVR, TP and Danielle Gallops.

Submit DNA sample.

No contact with Shopko Store and Walmart in Manitowoc.

timeConds.notes: under the Huber Law, to commence upon the completion of jail condition of probation in count 7 of 15 CF 147, this condition is on count 2 only.

It is hereby ordered that $20.00 restitution from 15 CM 544 be included in this case as a condition of probation.  The $20.00 restitution is to be paid by Meghan E. Kratochvil at 8444 Ole White Drive, Lake Ann, MI 54965.

Order for Jail Credit
It is hereby ordered, that the 108 days presentence credit ordered by the court be applied first to the straight jail sentence on Count 3.  Any remaining credit shall be then applied to Counts 1 and 2 to be used if the defendant's probation is revoked.   Cover Letter.

Count 2 - Burglary - No contest plea. 
Count 3 - Bail Jumping - No contest plea.   Convicted.   State moves to dismiss and read in counts 4, 5, and 6.   Motion granted.   Court orders defendant to submit a DNA sample.   Sentencing hearing is set for 09-16-15 at 1:30 p.m.

MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL - 
Defendant in custody.
The parties argue the motion.
The Court grants the motion and sets bail at $1,500.00 recognizance bond with the following conditions:
- Defendant must report daily to the Manitowoc County Sheriffs Department, by noon, and submit to random urine screens if requested to do so;
- Defendant must attend at least two NA meetings per week and return completed attendance form each Monday by Noon to the Clerk of Court office;
- Defendant is to have no contact with Cynthia Torstenson, Cody Spencer, Payton Spencer and Danielle Galllops.
Attorney Snavely to draft the order.
Minutes.
Motion hearing is set for 06-25-15 at 8:30 a.m.
Motion for Bail Reduction.

Plea date set for 06-03-15 at 11:30 is canceled.
Settlement conference with DA set for 07-16-15 at 2:00 p.m.

Order for Modifying Defendant's Bail.
Copy delivered to Sheriff.
Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.  
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 04-28-15 at 9:30 a.m.  Plea date is set for 06-03-15 at 11:30 a.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.  
BAIL MOTION 
Counsel argue.  Court modifies bail to $250.00 cash with the condition that defendant must report daily by 12;00 noon to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department.  
Amended Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail issued.   Copy filed.  
Minutes.
Motion for Bail Modification.

Defendant in custody.
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 03-24-15 at 10:00 a.m.
Minutes.
Adam Snavely, through Public Defender.
RE:  Cynthia Torstenson, on 03-09-15.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of operate without owner's consent, burglary, bail jumping and criminal damage to property.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 03-16-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $500.00 cash with the condition that he report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release.   Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
